text: Alcomie is a rural locality in the local government area of Circular Head in the North West region of Tasmania. It is located about south-east of the town of Smithton. The 2016 census determined a population of 56 for the state suburb of Alcomie. ==History== The locality was gazetted in 1959. Alcomie is the Aboriginal term for “beautiful view”. ==Geography== The western part of the locality is farmland, while the south-east remains heavily timbered. ==Road infrastructure== The C219 route (South Road) enters from the north-east and runs west, south and north-west before exiting, where it turns south along the western boundary for a short distance. Route C220 (Johns Hill Road) starts at an intersection with route C219 on the western boundary and runs away to the west. ==References== Category:Localities of Circular Head Council, Tasmania Category:Towns in Tasmania
title: Alcomie, Tasmania
